properties.description: The update's unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This ID becomes especially handy if you're using [webhooks](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#setwebhook), since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order. If there are no new updates for at least a week, then identifier of the next update will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.

properties.name: message
properties.description: *Optional*. New incoming message of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.

properties.name: edited_message
properties.description: *Optional*. New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited

properties.name: channel_post
properties.description: *Optional*. New incoming channel post of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.

properties.name: edited_channel_post
properties.description: *Optional*. New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited

properties.name: inline_query
properties.description: *Optional*. New incoming [inline](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inline-mode) query

properties.name: chosen_inline_result
properties.description: *Optional*. The result of an [inline](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inline-mode) query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the [feedback collecting](https://core.telegram.org/bots/inline#collecting-feedback) for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.

properties.name: callback_query
properties.description: *Optional*. New incoming callback query

properties.name: shipping_query
properties.description: *Optional*. New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price

properties.name: pre_checkout_query
properties.description: *Optional*. New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout

properties.name: poll
properties.description: *Optional*. New poll state. Bots receive only updates about stopped polls and polls, which are sent by the bot

properties.name: poll_answer
properties.description: *Optional*. A user changed their answer in a non-anonymous poll. Bots receive new votes only in polls that were sent by the bot itself.

properties.name: my_chat_member
properties.description: *Optional*. The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.

properties.name: chat_member
properties.description: *Optional*. A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify “chat\_member” in the list of *allowed\_updates* to receive these updates.

properties.name: chat_join_request
properties.description: *Optional*. A request to join the chat has been sent. The bot must have the *can\_invite\_users* administrator right in the chat to receive these updates.

objects.name: WebhookInfo
objects.description: Describes the current status of a webhook.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Webhook URL, may be empty if webhook is not set up

properties.name: has_custom_certificate
properties.description: *True*, if a custom certificate was provided for webhook certificate checks

properties.name: pending_update_count
properties.description: Number of updates awaiting delivery

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: *Optional*. Currently used webhook IP address

properties.name: last_error_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Unix time for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

properties.name: last_error_message
properties.description: *Optional*. Error message in human-readable format for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

properties.name: last_synchronization_error_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Unix time of the most recent error that happened when trying to synchronize available updates with Telegram datacenters

properties.name: max_connections
properties.description: *Optional*. The maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery

properties.name: allowed_updates
properties.description: *Optional*. A list of update types the bot is subscribed to. Defaults to all update types except *chat\_member*

objects.name: User
objects.description: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this user or bot. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: is_bot
properties.description: *True*, if this user is a bot

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: User's or bot's first name

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: *Optional*. User's or bot's last name

properties.name: username
properties.description: *Optional*. User's or bot's username

properties.name: language_code
properties.description: *Optional*. [IETF language tag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) of the user's language

properties.name: is_premium
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if this user is a Telegram Premium user

properties.name: added_to_attachment_menu
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if this user added the bot to the attachment menu

properties.name: can_join_groups
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can be invited to groups. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getme).

properties.name: can_read_all_group_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if [privacy mode](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#privacy-mode) is disabled for the bot. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getme).

properties.name: supports_inline_queries
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot supports inline queries. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getme).

objects.name: Chat
objects.description: This object represents a chat.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of chat, can be either “private”, “group”, “supergroup” or “channel”

properties.name: title
properties.description: *Optional*. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

properties.name: username
properties.description: *Optional*. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: *Optional*. First name of the other party in a private chat

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Last name of the other party in a private chat

properties.name: is_forum
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the supergroup chat is a forum (has [topics](https://telegram.org/blog/topics-in-groups-collectible-usernames#topics-in-groups) enabled)

properties.name: photo
properties.description: *Optional*. Chat photo. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: active_usernames
properties.description: *Optional*. If non-empty, the list of all [active chat usernames](https://telegram.org/blog/topics-in-groups-collectible-usernames#collectible-usernames); for private chats, supergroups and channels. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: emoji_status_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Custom emoji identifier of emoji status of the other party in a private chat. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: bio
properties.description: *Optional*. Bio of the other party in a private chat. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: has_private_forwards
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if privacy settings of the other party in the private chat allows to use `tg://user?id=<user_id>` links only in chats with the user. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: has_restricted_voice_and_video_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the privacy settings of the other party restrict sending voice and video note messages in the private chat. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: join_to_send_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if users need to join the supergroup before they can send messages. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: join_by_request
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if all users directly joining the supergroup need to be approved by supergroup administrators. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: description
properties.description: *Optional*. Description, for groups, supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: *Optional*. Primary invite link, for groups, supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: pinned_message
properties.description: *Optional*. The most recent pinned message (by sending date). Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: permissions
properties.description: *Optional*. Default chat member permissions, for groups and supergroups. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: slow_mode_delay
properties.description: *Optional*. For supergroups, the minimum allowed delay between consecutive messages sent by each unpriviledged user; in seconds. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: message_auto_delete_time
properties.description: *Optional*. The time after which all messages sent to the chat will be automatically deleted; in seconds. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: has_aggressive_anti_spam_enabled
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if aggressive anti-spam checks are enabled in the supergroup. The field is only available to chat administrators. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: has_hidden_members
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if non-administrators can only get the list of bots and administrators in the chat. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: has_protected_content
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if messages from the chat can't be forwarded to other chats. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: sticker_set_name
properties.description: *Optional*. For supergroups, name of group sticker set. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: can_set_sticker_set
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can change the group sticker set. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: linked_chat_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique identifier for the linked chat, i.e. the discussion group identifier for a channel and vice versa; for supergroups and channel chats. This identifier may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

properties.name: location
properties.description: *Optional*. For supergroups, the location to which the supergroup is connected. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getchat).

objects.name: Message
objects.description: This object represents a message.

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat

properties.name: message_thread_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique identifier of a message thread to which the message belongs; for supergroups only

properties.name: from
properties.description: *Optional*. Sender of the message; empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.

properties.name: sender_chat
properties.description: *Optional*. Sender of the message, sent on behalf of a chat. For example, the channel itself for channel posts, the supergroup itself for messages from anonymous group administrators, the linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the discussion group. For backward compatibility, the field *from* contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Conversation the message belongs to

properties.name: forward_from
properties.description: *Optional*. For forwarded messages, sender of the original message

properties.name: forward_from_chat
properties.description: *Optional*. For messages forwarded from channels or from anonymous administrators, information about the original sender chat

properties.name: forward_from_message_id
properties.description: *Optional*. For messages forwarded from channels, identifier of the original message in the channel

properties.name: forward_signature
properties.description: *Optional*. For forwarded messages that were originally sent in channels or by an anonymous chat administrator, signature of the message sender if present

properties.name: forward_sender_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Sender's name for messages forwarded from users who disallow adding a link to their account in forwarded messages

properties.name: forward_date
properties.description: *Optional*. For forwarded messages, date the original message was sent in Unix time

properties.name: is_topic_message
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the message is sent to a forum topic

properties.name: is_automatic_forward
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the message is a channel post that was automatically forwarded to the connected discussion group

properties.name: reply_to_message
properties.description: *Optional*. For replies, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further *reply\_to\_message* fields even if it itself is a reply.

properties.name: via_bot
properties.description: *Optional*. Bot through which the message was sent

properties.name: edit_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Date the message was last edited in Unix time

properties.name: has_protected_content
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the message can't be forwarded

properties.name: media_group_id
properties.description: *Optional*. The unique identifier of a media message group this message belongs to

properties.name: author_signature
properties.description: *Optional*. Signature of the post author for messages in channels, or the custom title of an anonymous group administrator

properties.name: text
properties.description: *Optional*. For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message

properties.name: entities
properties.description: *Optional*. For text messages, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the text

properties.name: animation
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is an animation, information about the animation. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the *document* field will also be set

properties.name: audio
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is an audio file, information about the file

properties.name: document
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a general file, information about the file

properties.name: photo
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

properties.name: sticker
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

properties.name: video
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a video, information about the video

properties.name: video_note
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a [video note](https://telegram.org/blog/video-messages-and-telescope), information about the video message

properties.name: voice
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a voice message, information about the file

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption for the animation, audio, document, photo, video or voice

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. For messages with a caption, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the caption

properties.name: has_media_spoiler
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the message media is covered by a spoiler animation

properties.name: contact
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

properties.name: dice
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a dice with random value

properties.name: game
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a game, information about the game. [More about games »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#games)

properties.name: poll
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a native poll, information about the poll

properties.name: venue
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a venue, information about the venue. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the *location* field will also be set

properties.name: location
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a shared location, information about the location

properties.name: new_chat_members
properties.description: *Optional*. New members that were added to the group or supergroup and information about them (the bot itself may be one of these members)

properties.name: left_chat_member
properties.description: *Optional*. A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be the bot itself)

properties.name: new_chat_title
properties.description: *Optional*. A chat title was changed to this value

properties.name: new_chat_photo
properties.description: *Optional*. A chat photo was change to this value

properties.name: delete_chat_photo
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the chat photo was deleted

properties.name: group_chat_created
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the group has been created

properties.name: supergroup_chat_created
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply\_to\_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.

properties.name: channel_chat_created
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply\_to\_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.

properties.name: message_auto_delete_timer_changed
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: auto-delete timer settings changed in the chat

properties.name: migrate_to_chat_id
properties.description: *Optional*. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: migrate_from_chat_id
properties.description: *Optional*. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: pinned_message
properties.description: *Optional*. Specified message was pinned. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further *reply\_to\_message* fields even if it is itself a reply.

properties.name: invoice
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is an invoice for a [payment](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#payments), information about the invoice. [More about payments »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#payments)

properties.name: successful_payment
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a service message about a successful payment, information about the payment. [More about payments »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#payments)

properties.name: user_shared
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: a user was shared with the bot

properties.name: chat_shared
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: a chat was shared with the bot

properties.name: connected_website
properties.description: *Optional*. The domain name of the website on which the user has logged in. [More about Telegram Login »](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login)

properties.name: write_access_allowed
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the user allowed the bot added to the attachment menu to write messages

properties.name: passport_data
properties.description: *Optional*. Telegram Passport data

properties.name: proximity_alert_triggered
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message. A user in the chat triggered another user's proximity alert while sharing Live Location.

properties.name: forum_topic_created
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: forum topic created

properties.name: forum_topic_edited
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: forum topic edited

properties.name: forum_topic_closed
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: forum topic closed

properties.name: forum_topic_reopened
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: forum topic reopened

properties.name: general_forum_topic_hidden
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the 'General' forum topic hidden

properties.name: general_forum_topic_unhidden
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the 'General' forum topic unhidden

properties.name: video_chat_scheduled
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: video chat scheduled

properties.name: video_chat_started
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: video chat started

properties.name: video_chat_ended
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: video chat ended

properties.name: video_chat_participants_invited
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: new participants invited to a video chat

properties.name: web_app_data
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: data sent by a Web App

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: *Optional*. Inline keyboard attached to the message. `login_url` buttons are represented as ordinary `url` buttons.

objects.name: MessageId
objects.description: This object represents a unique message identifier.

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier

objects.name: MessageEntity
objects.description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the entity. Currently, can be “mention” (`@username`), “hashtag” (`#hashtag`), “cashtag” (`$USD`), “bot\_command” (`/start@jobs_bot`), “url” (`https://telegram.org`), “email” (`do-not-reply@telegram.org`), “phone\_number” (`+1-212-555-0123`), “bold” (**bold text**), “italic” (*italic text*), “underline” (underlined text), “strikethrough” (strikethrough text), “spoiler” (spoiler message), “code” (monowidth string), “pre” (monowidth block), “text\_link” (for clickable text URLs), “text\_mention” (for users [without usernames](https://telegram.org/blog/edit#new-mentions)), “custom\_emoji” (for inline custom emoji stickers)

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Offset in [UTF-16 code units](https://core.telegram.org/api/entities#entity-length) to the start of the entity

properties.name: length
properties.description: Length of the entity in [UTF-16 code units](https://core.telegram.org/api/entities#entity-length)

properties.name: url
properties.description: *Optional*. For “text\_link” only, URL that will be opened after user taps on the text

properties.name: user
properties.description: *Optional*. For “text\_mention” only, the mentioned user

properties.name: language
properties.description: *Optional*. For “pre” only, the programming language of the entity text

properties.name: custom_emoji_id
properties.description: *Optional*. For “custom\_emoji” only, unique identifier of the custom emoji. Use [getCustomEmojiStickers](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getcustomemojistickers) to get full information about the sticker

objects.name: PhotoSize
objects.description: This object represents one size of a photo or a [file](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#document) / [sticker](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sticker) thumbnail.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Photo width

properties.name: height
properties.description: Photo height

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes

objects.name: Animation
objects.description: This object represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound).

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Video width as defined by sender

properties.name: height
properties.description: Video height as defined by sender

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: *Optional*. Animation thumbnail as defined by sender

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Original animation filename as defined by sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: *Optional*. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

objects.name: Audio
objects.description: This object represents an audio file to be treated as music by the Telegram clients.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: performer
properties.description: *Optional*. Performer of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

properties.name: title
properties.description: *Optional*. Title of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Original filename as defined by sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: *Optional*. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: *Optional*. Thumbnail of the album cover to which the music file belongs

objects.name: Document
objects.description: This object represents a general file (as opposed to [photos](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#photosize), [voice messages](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#voice) and [audio files](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#audio)).

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: *Optional*. Document thumbnail as defined by sender

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Original filename as defined by sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: *Optional*. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

objects.name: Video
objects.description: This object represents a video file.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Video width as defined by sender

properties.name: height
properties.description: Video height as defined by sender

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: *Optional*. Video thumbnail

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Original filename as defined by sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: *Optional*. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

objects.name: VideoNote
objects.description: This object represents a [video message](https://telegram.org/blog/video-messages-and-telescope) (available in Telegram apps as of [v.4.0](https://telegram.org/blog/video-messages-and-telescope)).

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: length
properties.description: Video width and height (diameter of the video message) as defined by sender

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: *Optional*. Video thumbnail

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes

objects.name: Voice
objects.description: This object represents a voice note.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: *Optional*. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

objects.name: Contact
objects.description: This object represents a phone contact.

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: Contact's phone number

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: Contact's first name

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Contact's last name

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Contact's user identifier in Telegram. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: vcard
properties.description: *Optional*. Additional data about the contact in the form of a [vCard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VCard)

objects.name: Dice
objects.description: This object represents an animated emoji that displays a random value.

properties.name: emoji
properties.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value of the dice, 1-6 for “🎲”, “🎯” and “🎳” base emoji, 1-5 for “🏀” and “⚽” base emoji, 1-64 for “🎰” base emoji

objects.name: PollOption
objects.description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

properties.name: voter_count
properties.description: Number of users that voted for this option

objects.name: PollAnswer
objects.description: This object represents an answer of a user in a non-anonymous poll.

properties.name: poll_id
properties.description: Unique poll identifier

properties.name: user
properties.description: The user, who changed the answer to the poll

properties.name: option_ids
properties.description: 0-based identifiers of answer options, chosen by the user. May be empty if the user retracted their vote.

objects.name: Poll
objects.description: This object contains information about a poll.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique poll identifier

properties.name: question
properties.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

properties.name: options
properties.description: List of poll options

properties.name: total_voter_count
properties.description: Total number of users that voted in the poll

properties.name: is_closed
properties.description: *True*, if the poll is closed

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: *True*, if the poll is anonymous

properties.name: type
properties.description: Poll type, currently can be “regular” or “quiz”

properties.name: allows_multiple_answers
properties.description: *True*, if the poll allows multiple answers

properties.name: correct_option_id
properties.description: *Optional*. 0-based identifier of the correct answer option. Available only for polls in the quiz mode, which are closed, or was sent (not forwarded) by the bot or to the private chat with the bot.

properties.name: explanation
properties.description: *Optional*. Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters

properties.name: explanation_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. Special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the *explanation*

properties.name: open_period
properties.description: *Optional*. Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation

properties.name: close_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed

objects.name: Location
objects.description: This object represents a point on the map.

properties.name: longitude
properties.description: Longitude as defined by sender

properties.name: latitude
properties.description: Latitude as defined by sender

properties.name: horizontal_accuracy
properties.description: *Optional*. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

properties.name: live_period
properties.description: *Optional*. Time relative to the message sending date, during which the location can be updated; in seconds. For active live locations only.

properties.name: heading
properties.description: *Optional*. The direction in which user is moving, in degrees; 1-360. For active live locations only.

properties.name: proximity_alert_radius
properties.description: *Optional*. The maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. For sent live locations only.

objects.name: Venue
objects.description: This object represents a venue.

properties.name: location
properties.description: Venue location. Can't be a live location

properties.name: title
properties.description: Name of the venue

properties.name: address
properties.description: Address of the venue

properties.name: foursquare_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Foursquare identifier of the venue

properties.name: foursquare_type
properties.description: *Optional*. Foursquare type of the venue. (For example, “arts\_entertainment/default”, “arts\_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

properties.name: google_place_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Google Places identifier of the venue

properties.name: google_place_type
properties.description: *Optional*. Google Places type of the venue. (See [supported types](https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/supported_types).)

objects.name: WebAppData
objects.description: Describes data sent from a [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps) to the bot.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The data. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

properties.name: button_text
properties.description: Text of the *web\_app* keyboard button from which the Web App was opened. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

objects.name: ProximityAlertTriggered
objects.description: This object represents the content of a service message, sent whenever a user in the chat triggers a proximity alert set by another user.

properties.name: traveler
properties.description: User that triggered the alert

properties.name: watcher
properties.description: User that set the alert

properties.name: distance
properties.description: The distance between the users

objects.name: MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a change in auto-delete timer settings.

properties.name: message_auto_delete_time
properties.description: New auto-delete time for messages in the chat; in seconds

objects.name: ForumTopicCreated
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a new forum topic created in the chat.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the topic

properties.name: icon_color
properties.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format

properties.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon

objects.name: ForumTopicClosed
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic closed in the chat. Currently holds no information.

objects.name: ForumTopicEdited
objects.description: This object represents a service message about an edited forum topic.

properties.name: name
properties.description: *Optional*. New name of the topic, if it was edited

properties.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: *Optional*. New identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon, if it was edited; an empty string if the icon was removed

objects.name: ForumTopicReopened
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic reopened in the chat. Currently holds no information.

objects.name: GeneralForumTopicHidden
objects.description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic hidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

objects.name: GeneralForumTopicUnhidden
objects.description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic unhidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

objects.name: UserShared
objects.description: This object contains information about the user whose identifier was shared with the bot using a [KeyboardButtonRequestUser](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#keyboardbuttonrequestuser) button.

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Identifier of the request

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: Identifier of the shared user. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot may not have access to the user and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the user is already known to the bot by some other means.

objects.name: ChatShared
objects.description: This object contains information about the chat whose identifier was shared with the bot using a [KeyboardButtonRequestChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#keyboardbuttonrequestchat) button.

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Identifier of the request

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Identifier of the shared chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot may not have access to the chat and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the chat is already known to the bot by some other means.

objects.name: WriteAccessAllowed
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a user allowing a bot added to the attachment menu to write messages. Currently holds no information.

objects.name: VideoChatScheduled
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat scheduled in the chat.

properties.name: start_date
properties.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the video chat is supposed to be started by a chat administrator

objects.name: VideoChatStarted
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat started in the chat. Currently holds no information.

objects.name: VideoChatEnded
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat ended in the chat.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Video chat duration in seconds

objects.name: VideoChatParticipantsInvited
objects.description: This object represents a service message about new members invited to a video chat.

properties.name: users
properties.description: New members that were invited to the video chat

objects.name: UserProfilePhotos
objects.description: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

properties.name: total_count
properties.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has

properties.name: photos
properties.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)

objects.name: File
objects.description:
This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link `https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>`. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling [getFile](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getfile).

The maximum file size to download is 20 MB

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

properties.name: file_path
properties.description: *Optional*. File path. Use `https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>` to get the file.

objects.name: WebAppInfo
objects.description: Describes a [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps).

properties.name: url
properties.description: An HTTPS URL of a Web App to be opened with additional data as specified in [Initializing Web Apps](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps#initializing-web-apps)

objects.name: ReplyKeyboardMarkup
objects.description: This object represents a [custom keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards) with reply options (see [Introduction to bots](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards) for details and examples).

properties.name: keyboard
properties.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of [KeyboardButton](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#keyboardbutton) objects

properties.name: is_persistent
properties.description: *Optional*. Requests clients to always show the keyboard when the regular keyboard is hidden. Defaults to *false*, in which case the custom keyboard can be hidden and opened with a keyboard icon.

properties.name: resize_keyboard
properties.description: *Optional*. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to *false*, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

properties.name: one_time_keyboard
properties.description: *Optional*. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat - the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to *false*.

properties.name: input_field_placeholder
properties.description: *Optional*. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters

properties.name: selective
properties.description:
*Optional*. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the *text* of the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#message) object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has *reply\_to\_message\_id*), sender of the original message.  

*Example:* A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

objects.name: KeyboardButton
objects.description: This object represents one button of the reply keyboard. For simple text buttons, *String* can be used instead of this object to specify the button text. The optional fields *web\_app*, *request\_user*, *request\_chat*, *request\_contact*, *request\_location*, and *request\_poll* are mutually exclusive.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text of the button. If none of the optional fields are used, it will be sent as a message when the button is pressed

properties.name: request_user
properties.description: *Optional.* If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable users. Tapping on any user will send their identifier to the bot in a “user\_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_chat
properties.description: *Optional.* If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable chats. Tapping on a chat will send its identifier to the bot in a “chat\_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_contact
properties.description: *Optional*. If *True*, the user's phone number will be sent as a contact when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_location
properties.description: *Optional*. If *True*, the user's current location will be sent when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_poll
properties.description: *Optional*. If specified, the user will be asked to create a poll and send it to the bot when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: web_app
properties.description: *Optional*. If specified, the described [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps) will be launched when the button is pressed. The Web App will be able to send a “web\_app\_data” service message. Available in private chats only.

objects.name: KeyboardButtonRequestUser
objects.description: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable user. The identifier of the selected user will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed.

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the [UserShared](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#usershared) object. Must be unique within the message

properties.name: user_is_bot
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request a bot, pass *False* to request a regular user. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: user_is_premium
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request a premium user, pass *False* to request a non-premium user. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

objects.name: KeyboardButtonRequestChat
objects.description: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable chat. The identifier of the selected chat will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed.

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the [ChatShared](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatshared) object. Must be unique within the message

properties.name: chat_is_channel
properties.description: Pass *True* to request a channel chat, pass *False* to request a group or a supergroup chat.

properties.name: chat_is_forum
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request a forum supergroup, pass *False* to request a non-forum chat. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: chat_has_username
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request a supergroup or a channel with a username, pass *False* to request a chat without a username. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: chat_is_created
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request a chat owned by the user. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: user_administrator_rights
properties.description: *Optional*. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the user in the chat. The rights must be a superset of *bot\_administrator\_rights*. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: bot_administrator_rights
properties.description: *Optional*. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the bot in the chat. The rights must be a subset of *user\_administrator\_rights*. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: bot_is_member
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request a chat with the bot as a member. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

objects.name: KeyboardButtonPollType
objects.description: This object represents type of a poll, which is allowed to be created and sent when the corresponding button is pressed.

properties.name: type
properties.description: *Optional*. If *quiz* is passed, the user will be allowed to create only polls in the quiz mode. If *regular* is passed, only regular polls will be allowed. Otherwise, the user will be allowed to create a poll of any type.

objects.name: ReplyKeyboardRemove
objects.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see [ReplyKeyboardMarkup](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#replykeyboardmarkup)).

properties.name: remove_keyboard
properties.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use *one\_time\_keyboard* in [ReplyKeyboardMarkup](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#replykeyboardmarkup))

properties.name: selective
properties.description:
*Optional*. Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the *text* of the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#message) object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has *reply\_to\_message\_id*), sender of the original message.  

*Example:* A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.

objects.name: InlineKeyboardMarkup
objects.description: This object represents an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) that appears right next to the message it belongs to.

properties.name: inline_keyboard
properties.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of [InlineKeyboardButton](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinekeyboardbutton) objects

objects.name: InlineKeyboardButton
objects.description: This object represents one button of an inline keyboard. You **must** use exactly one of the optional fields.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Label text on the button

properties.name: url
properties.description: *Optional*. HTTP or tg:// URL to be opened when the button is pressed. Links `tg://user?id=<user_id>` can be used to mention a user by their ID without using a username, if this is allowed by their privacy settings.

properties.name: callback_data
properties.description: *Optional*. Data to be sent in a [callback query](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#callbackquery) to the bot when button is pressed, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: web_app
properties.description: *Optional*. Description of the [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps) that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method [answerWebAppQuery](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#answerwebappquery). Available only in private chats between a user and the bot.

properties.name: login_url
properties.description: *Optional*. An HTTPS URL used to automatically authorize the user. Can be used as a replacement for the [Telegram Login Widget](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login).

properties.name: switch_inline_query
properties.description:
*Optional*. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. May be empty, in which case just the bot's username will be inserted.  

**Note:** This offers an easy way for users to start using your bot in [inline mode](https://core.telegram.org/bots/inline) when they are currently in a private chat with it. Especially useful when combined with [*switch\_pm…*](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#answerinlinequery) actions - in this case the user will be automatically returned to the chat they switched from, skipping the chat selection screen.

properties.name: switch_inline_query_current_chat
properties.description:
*Optional*. If set, pressing the button will insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the current chat's input field. May be empty, in which case only the bot's username will be inserted.  

This offers a quick way for the user to open your bot in inline mode in the same chat - good for selecting something from multiple options.

properties.name: callback_game
properties.description:
*Optional*. Description of the game that will be launched when the user presses the button.  

**NOTE:** This type of button **must** always be the first button in the first row.

properties.name: pay
properties.description:
*Optional*. Specify *True*, to send a [Pay button](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#payments).  

**NOTE:** This type of button **must** always be the first button in the first row and can only be used in invoice messages.

objects.name: LoginUrl
objects.description:
This object represents a parameter of the inline keyboard button used to automatically authorize a user. Serves as a great replacement for the [Telegram Login Widget](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login) when the user is coming from Telegram. All the user needs to do is tap/click a button and confirm that they want to log in:

Telegram apps support these buttons as of [version 5.7](https://telegram.org/blog/privacy-discussions-web-bots#meet-seamless-web-bots).

Sample bot: [@discussbot](https://t.me/discussbot)

properties.name: url
properties.description:
An HTTPS URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in [Receiving authorization data](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#receiving-authorization-data).  

**NOTE:** You **must** always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in [Checking authorization](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#checking-authorization).

properties.name: forward_text
properties.description: *Optional*. New text of the button in forwarded messages.

properties.name: bot_username
properties.description: *Optional*. Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See [Setting up a bot](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#setting-up-a-bot) for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The *url*'s domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See [Linking your domain to the bot](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#linking-your-domain-to-the-bot) for more details.

properties.name: request_write_access
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

objects.name: CallbackQuery
objects.description: This object represents an incoming callback query from a callback button in an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards). If the button that originated the query was attached to a message sent by the bot, the field *message* will be present. If the button was attached to a message sent via the bot (in [inline mode](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inline-mode)), the field *inline\_message\_id* will be present. Exactly one of the fields *data* or *game\_short\_name* will be present.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this query

properties.name: from
properties.description: Sender

properties.name: message
properties.description: *Optional*. Message with the callback button that originated the query. Note that message content and message date will not be available if the message is too old

properties.name: inline_message_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Identifier of the message sent via the bot in inline mode, that originated the query.

properties.name: chat_instance
properties.description: Global identifier, uniquely corresponding to the chat to which the message with the callback button was sent. Useful for high scores in [games](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#games).

properties.name: data
properties.description: *Optional*. Data associated with the callback button. Be aware that the message originated the query can contain no callback buttons with this data.

properties.name: game_short_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Short name of a [Game](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#games) to be returned, serves as the unique identifier for the game

objects.name: ForceReply
objects.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice [privacy mode](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#privacy-mode).

properties.name: force_reply
properties.description: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'

properties.name: input_field_placeholder
properties.description: *Optional*. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the reply is active; 1-64 characters

properties.name: selective
properties.description: *Optional*. Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the *text* of the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#message) object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has *reply\_to\_message\_id*), sender of the original message.

objects.name: ChatPhoto
objects.description: This object represents a chat photo.

properties.name: small_file_id
properties.description: File identifier of small (160x160) chat photo. This file\_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

properties.name: small_file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique file identifier of small (160x160) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: big_file_id
properties.description: File identifier of big (640x640) chat photo. This file\_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

properties.name: big_file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique file identifier of big (640x640) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

objects.name: ChatInviteLink
objects.description: Represents an invite link for a chat.

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: The invite link. If the link was created by another chat administrator, then the second part of the link will be replaced with “…”.

properties.name: creator
properties.description: Creator of the link

properties.name: creates_join_request
properties.description: *True*, if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators

properties.name: is_primary
properties.description: *True*, if the link is primary

properties.name: is_revoked
properties.description: *True*, if the link is revoked

properties.name: name
properties.description: *Optional*. Invite link name

properties.name: expire_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire or has been expired

properties.name: member_limit
properties.description: *Optional*. The maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

properties.name: pending_join_request_count
properties.description: *Optional*. Number of pending join requests created using this link

objects.name: ChatAdministratorRights
objects.description: Represents the rights of an administrator in a chat.

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: *True*, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

properties.name: can_manage_chat
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can access the chat event log, chat statistics, message statistics in channels, see channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege

properties.name: can_delete_messages
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

properties.name: can_manage_video_chats
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can manage video chats

properties.name: can_restrict_members
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

properties.name: can_promote_members
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_post_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the administrator can post in the channel; channels only

properties.name: can_edit_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; channels only

properties.name: can_pin_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to pin messages; groups and supergroups only

properties.name: can_manage_topics
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; supergroups only

objects.name: ChatMember
objects.description:
This object contains information about one member of a chat. Currently, the following 6 types of chat members are supported:

* [ChatMemberOwner](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmemberowner)
* [ChatMemberAdministrator](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmemberadministrator)
* [ChatMemberMember](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmembermember)
* [ChatMemberRestricted](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmemberrestricted)
* [ChatMemberLeft](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmemberleft)
* [ChatMemberBanned](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmemberbanned)

objects.name: ChatMemberOwner
objects.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmember) that owns the chat and has all administrator privileges.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “creator”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: *True*, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

properties.name: custom_title
properties.description: *Optional*. Custom title for this user

objects.name: ChatMemberAdministrator
objects.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmember) that has some additional privileges.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “administrator”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

properties.name: can_be_edited
properties.description: *True*, if the bot is allowed to edit administrator privileges of that user

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: *True*, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

properties.name: can_manage_chat
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can access the chat event log, chat statistics, message statistics in channels, see channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege

properties.name: can_delete_messages
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

properties.name: can_manage_video_chats
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can manage video chats

properties.name: can_restrict_members
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

properties.name: can_promote_members
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_post_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the administrator can post in the channel; channels only

properties.name: can_edit_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; channels only

properties.name: can_pin_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to pin messages; groups and supergroups only

properties.name: can_manage_topics
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; supergroups only

properties.name: custom_title
properties.description: *Optional*. Custom title for this user

objects.name: ChatMemberMember
objects.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmember) that has no additional privileges or restrictions.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “member”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

objects.name: ChatMemberRestricted
objects.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmember) that is under certain restrictions in the chat. Supergroups only.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “restricted”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

properties.name: is_member
properties.description: *True*, if the user is a member of the chat at the moment of the request

properties.name: can_send_messages
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, invoices, locations and venues

properties.name: can_send_audios
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send audios

properties.name: can_send_documents
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send documents

properties.name: can_send_photos
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send photos

properties.name: can_send_videos
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send videos

properties.name: can_send_video_notes
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send video notes

properties.name: can_send_voice_notes
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send voice notes

properties.name: can_send_polls
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send polls

properties.name: can_send_other_messages
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

properties.name: can_add_web_page_previews
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_pin_messages
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to pin messages

properties.name: can_manage_topics
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to create forum topics

properties.name: until_date
properties.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; unix time. If 0, then the user is restricted forever

objects.name: ChatMemberLeft
objects.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmember) that isn't currently a member of the chat, but may join it themselves.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “left”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

objects.name: ChatMemberBanned
objects.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmember) that was banned in the chat and can't return to the chat or view chat messages.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “kicked”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

properties.name: until_date
properties.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; unix time. If 0, then the user is banned forever

objects.name: ChatMemberUpdated
objects.description: This object represents changes in the status of a chat member.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Chat the user belongs to

properties.name: from
properties.description: Performer of the action, which resulted in the change

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the change was done in Unix time

properties.name: old_chat_member
properties.description: Previous information about the chat member

properties.name: new_chat_member
properties.description: New information about the chat member

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: *Optional*. Chat invite link, which was used by the user to join the chat; for joining by invite link events only.

objects.name: ChatJoinRequest
objects.description: Represents a join request sent to a chat.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Chat to which the request was sent

properties.name: from
properties.description: User that sent the join request

properties.name: user_chat_id
properties.description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who sent the join request. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot can use this identifier for 24 hours to send messages until the join request is processed, assuming no other administrator contacted the user.

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the request was sent in Unix time

properties.name: bio
properties.description: *Optional*. Bio of the user.

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: *Optional*. Chat invite link that was used by the user to send the join request

objects.name: ChatPermissions
objects.description: Describes actions that a non-administrator user is allowed to take in a chat.

properties.name: can_send_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, invoices, locations and venues

properties.name: can_send_audios
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to send audios

properties.name: can_send_documents
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to send documents

properties.name: can_send_photos
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to send photos

properties.name: can_send_videos
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to send videos

properties.name: can_send_video_notes
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to send video notes

properties.name: can_send_voice_notes
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to send voice notes

properties.name: can_send_polls
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to send polls

properties.name: can_send_other_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

properties.name: can_add_web_page_previews
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings. Ignored in public supergroups

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_pin_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to pin messages. Ignored in public supergroups

properties.name: can_manage_topics
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to create forum topics. If omitted defaults to the value of can\_pin\_messages

objects.name: ChatLocation
objects.description: Represents a location to which a chat is connected.

properties.name: location
properties.description: The location to which the supergroup is connected. Can't be a live location.

properties.name: address
properties.description: Location address; 1-64 characters, as defined by the chat owner

objects.name: ForumTopic
objects.description: This object represents a forum topic.

properties.name: message_thread_id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the forum topic

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the topic

properties.name: icon_color
